definitions.definition: A cash payment of money by a company to its shareholders , usually made periodically (e.g., quarterly or annually ).
A number or expression that is to be divided by another.
Beneficial results from a metaphorical investment (of time , effort , etc.)
examples: His 10,000 hours of practice and recitals eventually paid dividends when he become first-chair violinist.

main_definition: ( finance ) A cash payment of money by a company to its shareholders , usually made periodically (e.g., quarterly or annually ).
secondary_definitions: ( arithmetic ) A number or expression that is to be divided by another.
( figuratively ) Beneficial results from a metaphorical investment (of time , effort , etc.)
